results.title: Calling Sydney Harbour
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows aspects of the commerce on Sydney Harbour. Also reveals the changing face of Sydney from the tugboats that work in the port.

results.title: By-pass
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A short film illustrating a typical administrative problem for discussion. Two office workers produce innovative designs that may prove to have long range cost-saving benefits. Neither of their superiors appears to be appreciative. One designer decides to by-pass his approach to his superior. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arch Nicholson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: By design
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Collings and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A jet plane, a boomerang, and a locomotive are shown as examples of successful design in which the right materials are used for the right purposes. Showing examples of the work of Australia’s industrial designers, the film explains that the purpose for which an article is intended determines the final design. Examples include household articles such as an electric iron, comfortable chairs, lamps, and saucepans.

results.title: The Bushman goes home
results.creator_credit: Eric Bedford and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A cattle station owner makes the long journey from his vast cattle station on the Gulf of Carpentaria to visit Melbourne and the cattle saleyards. He then flies back via the cattle fattening plains of New South Wales. Narrated by Nigel Lovell.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric Bedford and Australian National Film Board

results.title: The Burnie story
results.creator_credit: Associated Pulp and Paper Manufacturers and Cine Service
results.brief_description: The township of Burnie on the north-west coast of Tasmania with a population of 14,000 is the centre of the thriving pulp and paper manufacturing industry. This industry started in 1936 and produces from the forests in the surrounding country, not only timber for the building industry but from the timber waste all types of cardboard, and wrapping paper and even high-grade printing paper. The film shows the up-to-date and powerful machinery which is used from the time a tree is felled until the final paper product is shipped from the Burnie wharves. Afforestation is maintained to ensure the raw material will not be exhausted. Photography: Geoffrey Thompson. Narrated by Ray Chapman.

results.title: Blue Ice
results.creator_credit: Phillip Garth Law, Film Australia and External Affairs
results.brief_description: A record of the 1954 Australian National Antarctic Research Expedition, which relieved the scientific stations at Macquarie and Heard Islands and established a new station at Mawson on MacRobertson Land in Australian Antarctic Territory. The film describes the expedition’s departure from Melbourne in December 1953 and follows its 12,000 mile journey through high seas and pack ice, providing an insight into daily life at the stations and the challenges presented by often-difficult conditions. There is stunning footage of towering icebergs and masses of penguins as well as aerial reconnaissance and surveillance.

results.title: The Blowfly menace
results.creator_credit: A. C. McKay BVSc and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: For farmers and graziers this study of the life-cycle of the green blowfly and other flies associated with blowfly strike in sheep, and demonstrations of various methods of control, should prove both useful and interesting.
results.creator_credit_for_label: A. C. McKay BVSc and Australian Wool Corporation
